name: Travel Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night before climbing Carrauntoohill. It was excellent value with a huge breakfast included in the rate, so we were well fed for the climb! Room was great too, nice and big with a very good shower!! It's out of town though, so not convenient for nightlife, but if that's not important then go for it...
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: We spent the night here in family suite, which was two rooms, one with a king bed, and another room with two twins and a separate living area with sofa sleeper, of all the places we stayed, this was not only huge, but more importantly it was warm. Our excitement ended when we realized the internet wasn't working. Having two teens without internet brought immediate and lasting suffering for us. The staff did what they could and perhaps this was isolated, but at any rate an issue. The breakfast was wonderful and I highly recommend this place and it would have been 5 stars if the internet worked. The location is on the edge of town, but we found it a perfect place to start the ring of kerry. Again very nice staff and I would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Outstanding accommodations but fell short

reviews.text: Had a wedding and stayed here as part of a large group. Everything about it was brilliant, the room, the food, the bar , the staff.. Couldnt say enough good things about the hotel. Every member of the group was extremely happy with everything and we left knowing we would all go back in a heartbeat...
reviews.title: Brilliant, Would and have recommended to friends

reviews.text: we were very happy with our short stay at travel inn,we had one bedroom suite in which there were 3 of us and our daughters guide dog,found the suite very handy with dog as had patio door which they allowed us use very helpful as it saved us going in and out front hotel were very grateful for this,rooms lovely and big,beds very comfortable,room nice and warm,food in bar very good,staff very nice,girls on reception both on check in and out were very nice and helpful,only thing i would suggest is better signs on road coming from town,thanks again and def would return
reviews.title: short stay

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Travel Inn. Everything was perfect as mentioned in all the reviews below. We'd like to thank all the staff in the hotel, special thanks to George. Something unexpected happened to our car and George helped us to organise our time, giving our family a lift to town and collecting us from the parade. He also organise a mechanic on Paddy's Day. Many thanks and we'll definitely come back to Travel Inn. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: St Patrick's Weekend

reviews.text: I am just back from a 2 night stay at the travel inn with my family 4 of us. The rooms were very spacious, clean warm rooms, comfortable beds and the best power shower. Staff were very friendly and helpfull. We didnt use the hotel restaurant as it was easy to self cater in our one bedroom suite which had a microwave, fridge, kettle, toaster and utenils. I would stay here again as it was good value and we really enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: paddies weekend

reviews.text: So far this is the most comfortable of the four Irish hotels we've visited. The suite setup gives the kids their own room while mom and dad have a rom to themselves. The one bathroom that serves the suite has ceramic tile floors and walls and even a 120v outlet for us American tourists. Beds were quite comfortable as well, and the staff is friendly even by Irish standards. Location is a short drive from the city centre, but there's a nearby bus stop for those traveling without a rental car. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Spacious, comfortable, great for families

reviews.text: I am just back from a great weekend in Killarney staying in the travel inn.my friends and I (4 of us) had a two bedroom suite.it was spotless ,best power shower ever,fantastic staff,food is lovely and rooms very comfortable.i have stayed here so many times so i said it was about time I gave them a great review as the hotel and staff deserve it.i booked it again before I left.
reviews.title: Fantastic and friendly

reviews.text: My hubby & I stayed here for 1 night (business trip) & found it to be good value for money.
reviews.title: Good value and location

reviews.text: The bedroom was well appointed and very clean.
reviews.title: Very comfortable 1 bedroom suite

reviews.text: Just stayed at travel inn over the weekend for a hen party and I thought it was excellent. I know it is outside the town but it was fantastic nonetheless. Staff at reception were excellent, room fantastic, bed linen so comfy, shower was so powerful it was amazing. Would defo come back here and stay with my husband and 2 kids and would highly recommend to other hen parties. Thank you very much
reviews.title: Excellent
Spacious room with a lake and mountain view
reviews.text: We booked our stay online and it was very good value. After staying one night, we decided to stay a second and got the same good rate. The bed was large and comfortable (they called it a twin but it was 2 singles made into 1 bed, which suited us well) and the room was big and with a lovely view. There was a wide choice of things for breakfast and we enjoyed an evening meal in the bar. I liked the décor with stripy wood and rock finishes. I wonder why the bathroom taps in many hotels, like this one, make such a noise? The shower was incredibly powerful: doesn’t look as though they’re short of water in this part of the world!

Stayed at this hotel on 28th April 2013 as My husband and two children were taking part in a cycling event. The hotel was perfect and literally just around the corner from the race. We were only due to stay for one night but we were exhausted after the racing and couldn't face a five and a half hour journey back to Belfast. I asked at reception if they could provide us with a room for the second evening and they were more than helpful. We got the same room we had stayed in the night previous and at a reduced rate. Would highly recommend to family and friends. Perfect location and beautiful view from our window. We were able to keep the three bicycles in a secure room within the hotel and this was not a problem at all. The breakfast was lovely as was the food in the hotel restaurant. We intend to visit again during August for a more relaxed break and to see more of Kilarney.
reviews.title: Cycling Event weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to get away at the last minute for the husbands 51st Birthday and we looked on hotels.com and found a rate for the Travel Inn in Killarney that was almost too good to be true, but it was true and soooo worth the trip! We arrived April 15 and stayed tell April 17, room 303. When we arrived at the hotel, Sheila booked us in. I told her it was a get away for the hubbys birthday, so she upgraded us for free to a suite. This suite had 2 rooms plus the bathroom ( it was bigger then my brother-in-laws whole apartment in Dublin!) There was the bedroom that had a large bed, table and tv, desk and wardrobe. Then there is a connecting door that went into a large room that had 2 couches, tv and then on the other end of the sitting room there is a large table to seat 4/6 people, a kitchen area that has a microwave, kettle, fridge/freezer, sink and toaster and all the dishes. I run my own cleaning company and I have to give credit where credit is due to Yvonna, the housekeeper, I could honestly find NO FAULT in the cleaning department in this whole motel and believe me, I was searching for a cobweb but found none. I also want to say a big thanks to Helen the young lady that gladly gave us some shampoo for the AWESOME power shower (as I left home with out the shampoo.) There are tea/coffee facilities in the main lobby that are always full and hot and we had wifi in our room. I can honestly say as we travel all over Ireland and the world, this has to be one of the nicest and one of the cleanest places that we have stayed in in a long time. If it wasn't for the fact that it is a 5 hour drive each way, we would make it a regular stop on our list. The room came with breakfast and there is a great selection of cereals, breads and fruit and then the hot meal to go with it, so if you leave hungry here, it is your own fault. They even heat the plates for the hot breakie, don't find that in many places anymore. Monday night weather was gail force winds and rain and bright and early the next am, there were no signs of the tree limbs and mess in the parking lot from the storm, the grounds had already been cleaned up. A big thank you to all the staff, we will be back and keep up the excellent work, you are all AWESOME!
reviews.title: Birthday Get Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed over last night. I found the hotel on booking.com and then researched it on tripadvisor, the reviews were very good so I went onto the hotels own website and booked one night. The rate was excellent, in fact unbelievable. When we arrived I was impressed with the lovely foyer and the receptionist was so friendly, my first impressions were great. When we went to our room we were impressed again, the room was so spacious and clean and the bathroom was lovely. It had everything we needed and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was great too with a good choice. I would highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay again. We also had food in the bar and that was excellent, the presentation, the taste and value, we couldnt ask for more. The hotel may be a little out of town but well worth staying there.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel.

reviews.text: Affordable place with large suites and great service! There is also a restaurant and a bar that serve good food. Great place to stay if you go in large groups of ten to twenty people. The rooms have all the felicities you could ask for.
reviews.title: Short trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived here after no sleep the previous night. We arrived at appox 12noon and were shown straight to our room, no waiting for normal check in times. The rooms are very large and comfortable. We had a one bedroon suite. The furnishings are not luxurious but are more than adequate. The bed was very comfortable. There were two 2 seater couches, a table & 4 chairs and a kitchenette in the living area all of which were clean and in good condition. Sile on reception could't have been more helpful. The views from the rooms were great (3rd floor front of the building) we could see the lake and the snow capped mountains. This hotel seems ideal for family breaks as the rooms are so large and comfortable. We viewed the family rooms and these were perfect for a party of 5. At breakfast the following morning (after a great nights sleep) we had a nice brakfast and Margaret in the restaurant couldn't have been more pleasant & helpful. We will definately return to this hotel and recommend it to others
reviews.title: Very Friendly & Helpful Staff

reviews.text: We are a family of 5 and stayed here last week (Jan 2013). I will say that the size of the suite is fantastic - too big in fact. We'd have fit in smaller and it would have been cheaper but the online site only offers you one choice (the dearer one of course)
reviews.title: Overpriced for what you get

reviews.text: Semi self catering is a new term to me, and one I will run a mile from in future. A small kitchen with toaster, kettle and fridge - fine. A microwave oven and not a single cooking utensil supplied. No jug, or large bowl. completely useless.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Our room had a bad smell from drains - it disappeared after the first day having run water through and left windows open. I shouldn't have had to do that of course. I should have asked to be moved, but I reckoned there wouldn't be much better. The website had indicated they were full - in fact there were very few people staying.
reviews.title: Lovely, clean and welcoming hotel

description: The Travel Inn offers quality accommodation at superb hotel prices. Located on the Ring of Kerry and the Dingle Peninsula, The Travel Inn is within walking distance of Killarney Golf Club and Killarney Riding Stables. Stay at The Travel Inn and enjoy a warm welcome, comfy beds, great food in our on-site restaurant and bar and super low prices. The charming, spacious rooms have comfy beds, luxurious bathrooms and panoramic views of Killarney’s landscape.
